Sanders co: sponsored legislation in the late 1990s to allow the dumping of low-level nuclear waste from Vermont at a site in Texas, potentially Sierra Blanca.
Congress approved the bill: but Texas authorities ultimately rejected the plan and chose another location without any congressional approval, resulting in no waste being dumped in Sierra Blanca.
The claim accurately describes Sanders: role in leading the legislative effort, but it falsely implies that the waste was actually dumped in the poor Latino community.
The ad in question is from United We Suc: a dark-money group associated with the Big Tent Project Fund, which aims to boost moderates and criticize Sanders. Dark-money groups like these do not disclose their donors.
